intro: Lomatophyllum, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to the island of Madagascar, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plants are characterized by their unique, showy flowers that often resemble ghostly shapes, hence their common name. Lomatophyllum species typically have opposite, simple leaves and produce milky sap. These plants are often grown as ornamental plants due to their striking floral displays.
